content: anivia verily claire by claire slade anivia is a sweet little lace shawlette designed to use a single 100g skein of 4ply / fingering weight yarn with a simple lace pattern this shawl is the perfect introduction to lace knitting this is a triangular shawl knit sideways starting from one corner with increases made only along one edge anivia can also be made much larger just continue to work the main section until you reach your desired length if you want to make the shawl as large as possible with the yarn you have you will need to save at least 5% of your yardage for the final edging and bind off materials 420yds / 384m 4ply / fingering weight yarn 3 75mm / us5 needles sample shown in eden cottage tempo 4ply gauge 16sts x 24 row = 4 / 10cm in lace pattern blocked gauge is not critical but it will affect yardage measurements 56 wide x 28 at deepest point 142 x 71cm protected under uk copyright 2020 all rights reserved pattern for personal use only contact verilyknits@gmail com anivia 1 abbreviations pattern notes co cast on if working from the charts remember that all right side bobble bind off row are read from right to left and all wrong side row k knit are read from left to right p purl sts stitches on chart b the red box shows the repeated section repeat repeat so you will work the sts before the red box and then rs right side repeat the stitches within the red box until you have ws wrong side the number of stitches after the box left on your needle kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch and you will then work those stitches to the end of the k2tog knit 2sts together row k2tog tbl knit 2sts together through the back loops ssk slip 1st slip 1st knit the 2sts together yo yarnover m1 make 1 stitch by picking up the bar main section between the stitches with your left needle from back to front and knitting it through work row 1-16 of chart b / written version b a total the front of 15 times 140sts you can work the main section as many times as desired but remember to save some yarn for the instructions lower edge section i recommend ending on either a row 8 or 16 co 3sts lower edge setup section row 1 rs k to last 3sts m1 k3 row 2 ws k row 1 rs k repeat row 1-2 once then row 1 once more 143sts row 2 ws k row 3 k1 kfb k1 4sts bobble all sts on the ws as follows row 4 k row 5 k2 kfb k1 k1 *k1 return both sts to the left needle and k2tog row 6 k tbl repeat from * to end row 7 k2 m1 k3 6sts row 8 k row 9 k to last 3sts m1 k3 finishing row
